title: Buzz around the NFL: Will Burrow or Daniels be back on the field? Which coaches are on the hot seat?
content: Will Joe Burrow and Jayden Daniels play again this season? Are the Vikings worried about J.J. McCarthy? And which coaches are on the hot seat? Here's what we're hearing.

title: Top 3 of CFP unchanged; Tide drop, UGA to No. 4
content: Ohio State, Indiana and Texas A&M remained the top three teams in the latest College Football Playoff rankings, while Alabama dropped six spots to No. 10 and was replaced by Georgia at No. 4.

title: Lakers score 140 in LeBron's historic season debut
content: Lakers star LeBron James made his season debut against the Jazz, taking the court to begin an NBA-record 23rd season.

title: Raiola's brother Dayton decommits from Huskers
content: Dayton Raiola, a three-star passer in the 2026 class and the younger brother of Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola, announced his decommitment from the Huskers, reopening his recruitment weeks before the early signing period.

title: Federer aces election to International Tennis HOF
content: Roger Federer has been elected to the International Tennis Hall of Fame in his first year of eligibility. TV announcer and journalist Mary Carillo was selected in the contributor category.

title: After big win, Poch objects to 'regular' player talk
content: Mauricio Pochettino dismissed the idea of the United States having "regular players" after an alternate starting lineup thrashed Uruguay 5-1 on Tuesday in Tampa.

title: Pope rues 'poorly coached' Kentucky after blowout
content: Kentucky coach Mark Pope took responsibility for the Wildcats' struggles, saying his team is "completely discombobulated" after an 83-66 loss to Michigan State.

title: Deion: Need more time, but Buffs have 'right man'
content: Deion Sanders, who will post his second losing season in three years in Colorado, insists he is "the right man" to lead the Buffaloes but said he needs more time.

title: Nico Harrison, Mark Cuban and a 'palace coup': Inside a bitter feud for control in Dallas
content: Here's what led to the end of Nico Harrison's tenure with the Dallas Mavericks 11 games into the season, and how Mark Cuban was involved.

title: Wetzel: Was Al Davis right about Lane Kiffin?
content: In different circumstances, Kiffin could -- maybe even should -- leave Ole Miss. But not these circumstances.

title: Miller's new NFL mock draft: 32 first-round pick predictions -- and two trades -- five months out
content: How early could Ty Simpson go? What about Makai Lemon, David Bailey and Mansoor Delane? Let's project Round 1 of the 2026 draft -- plus two trades.

title: Can Colts RB Jonathan Taylor win MVP? Here's how he stacks up against four QB candidates
content: Matthew Stafford is now the favorite to win MVP, but can he hold off Drake Maye, Josh Allen, Patrick Mahomes and Taylor?

title: What Lakers insiders are monitoring as LeBron James makes his unprecedented return
content: As James begins his record-setting 23rd season in the NBA, here are the four biggest questions to answer.

title: NBA Power Rankings: Who provides the most stealth help for all 30 teams?
content: Insiders break down this week's power rankings, including who is the most important role player for every team.

title: 'From underdog to star,' Riley Tiernan breaks through in the NWSL
content: Two weeks before the season, the Rookie of the Year nominee didn't even know whether she'd make a team.

title: Statement win over Uruguay shows the USMNT has come a long way in 16 months
content: Sixteen months ago, the U.S. men's national team hit rock bottom, losing 1-0 to Uruguay to seal its group-stage elimination from the 2024 Copa America. Now things are very different.

title: How a baseball behemoth plans to get ... better? 3 offseason questions as Dodgers eye three-peat
content: L.A.'s blueprint to bolster a two-time defending champion will be among MLB's biggest stories this winter.

title: MLB 'reclamation' candidates: 6 free agents who could bounce back with new teams
content: Which veterans could revitalize their careers by returning to their previous -- better -- form in 2026?

title: Ranking men's basketball Freshman of the Year contenders: Who is No. 1?
content: AJ Dybantsa and Cameron Boozer have cases for the strongest season so far. Here's who else is in the running.

title: Women's college basketball Power Rankings: TCU in, Duke out, more movers
content: The first five teams hold steady while Oklahoma and Michigan make big jumps and TCU enters the top 16.

title: Woo's debut 2026 mock draft: Where Peterson, Dybantsa, Boozer could land
content: Early injuries scattering the No. 1 pick race? Only two guards in the top 10? Let's project all 30 picks for the 2026 first round.

title: Ranked: All 64 national teams that can still win the 2026 World Cup after latest eliminations
content: There are still 64 national teams that can win the FIFA World Cup next summer. Let's go through them all and rank where they stand.

title: Individual rankings for each position in Week 12
content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

title: Bad Bunny, big stage: How will 2026 halftime stack up with the most searched Super Bowl shows?
content: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl set is drawing early buzz, but search data shows which halftime shows have truly stood the test of time.

title: Navy's uniforms for 2025 Army-Navy game pay homage to USS Constitution
content: The uniform draws inspiration from the ship, which was one of the six original frigates of the U.S. Navy.

title: Why Haney is in an unusual spot heading into the Norman fight
content: Devin Haney is only 26, a pound-for-pound talent and unbeaten. So why is he facing a crossroads fight against Brian Norman Jr.?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona's Lewandowski wanted by AC Milan
content: AC Milan have made veteran Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski a target. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Burials of Medina bus crash victims from Hyderabad likely on Friday: Azharuddin
content: The Telangana Minorities Welfare Minister says the government has sought burials at the revered Jannat-ul-Baqi for Hyderabad victims of the devastating bus-tanker collision in Medina that killed 42 Indian pilgrims

title: BJP, JD(S) leaders extend support as agitation enters 20th day in Koppal
content: BJP MLC Hemalatha Naik has said that she will raise the issue of Baldota gold mine expansion once again during the Winter Session

title: MGNREGA employment declines for second year in a row
content: Lib Tech tracker shows 11.7% fall in persondays in FY 2025-26; States such as Uttarakhand and Telangana see steep drops

title: Corpus fund of ₹1 crore will be set up in KSPCB : Siddaramaiah
content: An award will be instituted in the name of environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka who passed away recently

title: Press bodies decry data protection law’s lack of exemptions for journalists
content: The Editors Guild of India and Digipub reiterate earlier objections to the law; the IT Ministry says an FAQ document addressing these concerns will be put out soon

title: Over 49 lakh Gujarat farmers to receive ₹986 crore under PM-KISAN
content: Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel and Agriculture Minister Jitu Vaghani distributed approval letters for agricultural assistance schemes worth over ₹11.68 lakh

title: Ex-Deputy Collector joins the poll fray in Kozhikode
content: E. Antihakumari, who retired from service in May 2025, is contesting the local body election as LDF candidate from the Mathottam ward of the Kozhikode Corporation

title: India extends Buddha relics exposition in Bhutan
content: The 16-day Global Peace Prayer Festival concludes in Thimphu with the full ordination of 270 nuns toward gender parity in the Vajrayana monastic tradition

title: CAG issues advisory to standardise govt. expenditure classification across India
content: A memorandum said the advisory for a uniform object head structure was made based on the recommendations of a Working Group and engagement with the Union Finance Ministry

title: HC cancels default bail given to three accused in liquor scam case
content: Dhanunjaya Reddy, Krishna Mohan Reddy, and Balaji Govindappa have been directed to approach the ACB Court for regular bail and surrender before it by November 26

title: Rift in BJP comes to the fore in Palakkad municipality
content: A memorandum signed by 117 BJP supporters has appealed to the RSS to reconsider the decision to field BJP State treasurer E. Krishnadas in Pattikkara. They say prefer a candidate from the ward

title: Govt. authorises CID to attach ₹68-crore worth properties of former YSRCP MLA Chevireddi Bhaskar Reddy in liquor scam case
content: Action follows a detailed report submitted by the Director-General of Police on the findings of the SIT that point to large-scale irregularities in the State’s excise policy during the previous regime

title: Madras High Court injuncts use of Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa scenes, songs in Aaromaley movie
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar grants the interim injunction pursuant to a copyright infringement suit filed by the producer of VTV

title: Telangana kicks off World Heritage Week with Hyderabad Old City walk
content: Week-long initiative planned to highlight and celebrate State’s tangible and intangible heritage through curated walks, cultural performances, competitions and a stakeholder round-table

title: 4-year-old run over and killed by school bus in Idukki, another child injured
content: Accident occurs on the premises of Giri Jyothi CMI Public School in Idukki. Police seize vehicle, take driver into custody

title: Kerala HC pulls up TDB for poor crowd management at Sabarimala
content: Court asks why preparations for the Mandalam-Makaravilakku season did not begin at least six months in advance and directs TDB to put in place scientific crowd management measures

title: Robotic technology to curb illegal water connections
content: The robotic technology enables quick detection of leakage sources without excessive road digging, says Deputy Chief Minister Shivakumar

title: National Mission on Tuber Crops proposed for popularising tuber crops
content: Proposal presented at the 20th International Symposium of the International Society for Tropical Root Crops under way in Thiruvananthapuram

title: Muslim body seeks separate government nodal agency for Haj and Umrah pilgrims
content: Highlights need for a dedicated department at the Centre through the Ministry of External Affairs and the Ministry of Minority Welfare, similar to the model followed by the State of Kerala

title: Zubeen was plied with alcohol by those with designs on his wealth: Assam CM
content: Himanta Biswa Sarma also said migrant Muslims were misusing the name of the Assamese cultural icon to save themselves from eviction

title: ‘Operation Sambhav’ foils Maoists’ bid to revive movement in Andhra Pradesh
content: The outlawed CPI (Maoist) has lost 16 of its key leaders since the launch of the operation six months ago, says ASR district Superintendent of Police Amit Bardar

title: Cubbon Park to host 11-day flower show from November 27
content: The show theme blends Children’s Day and Karnataka Rajyotsava, shaping the designs of the floral installations as well as the cultural programmes

title: Safe health advisory issued for pilgrims going to Sabarimala
content: It comes in view of cases of amoebic meningoencephalitis (a rare, severe infection of the brain) caused by Naegleria fowleri being reported in Kerala

title: No  parking facility for Sabarimala pilgrims at Kumily
content: Forest department has denied permission to Sabarimala pilgrims to park vehicles at Anavachal parking ground in Kumily

title: Indira Gandhi reshaped country with policies dedicated to ameliorating poverty, inequality: Sonia
content: Indira Gandhi's work reflected these beliefs that everyone has the right to live without oppression, prejudice, poverty, and violence, she said

title: State Legislature to start internship programme for students during Winter Session at Suvarna Soudha
content: The students will be chosen from Rani Channamma University, Karnataka University and Karnataka State Akka Mahadevi Women’s University

title: District Business Reform Action Plan to be implemented in Thiruvananthapuram,  Ernakulam, and Palakkad
content: District Business Reform Action Plan is a State-driven exercise enabling States to take the lead in driving business reforms at the district level as part of ease of doing business initiatives

title: Nadendla Manohar inspects paddy procurement, says every grain brought by farmers will be purchased
content: The government has procured 2.36 lakh tonnes so far, which is 36% higher than the procurement during the corresponding period the previous year, says the Civil Supplies Minister

title: SCR rolls out ₹3,200-crore track fencing project to enable high-speed travel in high density routes
content: Top officials said high-density routes, spanning 1,835 km, include key sections such as Secunderabad-Kazipet, Kazipet-Balharshah, Vijayawada-Kondapalli and Gooty-Wadi

title: It is for legislators to make the best of use of time given for discussion on development of NK, says Horatti
content: A dedicated day will be allotted during the Winter Session for discussing the issues concerning the region, according to the Council Chairman

title: Chandrababu Naidu and Pawan Kalyan hail Sathya Sai Baba’s model of humanitarian service
content: Baba’s gesture of providing drinking water, healthcare and education to the poor and downtrodden casts a powerful impact on rural Andhra Pradesh and beyond, says Chandrababu Naidu; the drinking water initiative worth hundreds of crores reflects the early version of today’s  schemes such as the Jal Jeevan Mission, observes Pawan Kalyan

title: Masked men, armed with swords and sticks, vandalise Bhopal cafe; four detained
content: According to the police, the incident took place around 7.10 p.m. on November 18 when several men entered the Magic Spot Cafe in the capital city’s Misrod area and began damaging the open cafe’s infrastructure

title: Digital evaluation in Kuvempu University: Many toppers secure fail marks, leaving them in shock
content: The college staff conducted counselling sessions for students, who were disappointed over the poor results

title: Madhya Pradesh’s Hawk Force Inspector killed in encounter with Maoists in Chhattisgarh
content: Ashish Sharma, 40, was leading a Hawk Force platoon in an inter-State joint operation when he sustained bullet injuries in his thigh and abdomen

title: A.P. Rythu Sangham seeks market support for banana, maize farmers
content: It urges the government that an investment assistance of ₹20,000 per year being provided to farmers should also be extended to those cultivating on lease

title: Govt. completes half term amid tussle over power sharing and suspense of Cabinet reshuffle
content: Siddaramaiah is expected to break Devaraj Urs's record as the longest-serving Chief Minister of Karnataka if he continues in office till Budget

title: BJP accuses Left parties, ‘urban naxals’ of shielding Maoists
content: Maintenance of internal security is among the top priorities of the Narendra Modi government, says BJP spokesperson

title: Authorities begin exercise of inspecting lockers of doctors, medical staff in hospitals of Jammu and Kashmir
content: As part of the process, the authorities in Shopian and Kulgam districts, in south Kashmir, inspected the lockers of doctors and medical staff at various hospitals, an officials said

title: Western India heritage to take centre stage at Bharatiya Kala Mahotsav in Hyderabad
content: The nine-day festival will showcase traditions from Gujarat, Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Goa, Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu

title: Sathya Sai Baba’s teachings continue to guide millions worldwide, say Sachin Tendulkar, Aishwarya Rai Bachchan
content: It reflects the global growth of the Sathya Sai movement, says the cricket icon; the role of Baba’s educational and healthcare institutions in providing free service is exemplary, observes the actor

title: Setback for Ghulam Nabi Azad's party as two former Ministers among leaders back in Congress
content: Former Members of Legislative Council (MLCs) Subash Gupta and Brij Mohan Sharma also rejoined Congress at a function organised to mark the 108th birth anniversary of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi

title: ICMR approves ₹6.2 crore for kidney research in Uddanam
content: Under the project, titled ‘Srikakulam Kidney Research Project’, the health department will identify individuals who are likely to develop kidney disease within a year or two and will provide early treatment to them; this will be done through tests

title: Minister Duraimurugan opens rejuvenated twin lakes near Katpadi
content: As part of restoration work, two lakes were desilted to the original depth of six metres. The lakes were also deepened to store additional rainwater during monsoon.

title: UDF delegation to highlight pilgrim ‘woes’ at Sabarimala
content: Law enforcers fail in regulating crowd, causing a potentially disastrous pile-up of pilgrims far beyond the holding capacity of Sabarimala, says Satheesan

title: YSRCP leaders blame MLA Balakrishna for attack on party office in Hindupur
content: The attackers were not stopped despite the presence of police and false cases were foisted upon YSRCP cadres, allege party’s women leaders

title: Gujarat State Forest and Environment Minister hails return of long-extinct tiger to forest
content: The settling of the tiger has prompted State Forest and Environment Minister Arjun Modhwadia to announce that Gujarat has become the abode of three big cats- the lion, leopard, and tiger

title: 'Safe' trap: How 19 women were drawn into extremism by Dr Shaheen; all untraceable
content: Authorities are actively searching for 19 women from Kanpur and surrounding areas who were reportedly influenced by arrested Jaish-e-Mohammed operative Dr. Shaheen Shahid. Investigators believe these women were radicalized through her manipulative speeches and outreach network.  Efforts are underway to locate them using various tracking methods to understand Dr. Shaheen's full operation.

title: F-35s, AI chips, and trillions: How MBS, once a ‘pariah’, took back Washington
content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, once a pariah, has made a remarkable comeback in Washington, securing significant US investment and military hardware.  His visit, marked by military fanfare and high-profile meetings, underscores Saudi Arabia's renewed strategic importance to the US, despite lingering human rights concerns. MBS skillfully leveraged geopolitical competition to his advantage.

title: 'Will be risky': Hardik, Bumrah to miss ODIs against South Africa
content: All-rounder Hardik Pandya is unlikely to feature in the upcoming ODI series against South Africa as he focuses on recovering from a quadriceps injury ahead of the T20 World Cup. Jasprit Bumrah is also expected to be rested from the ODI matches due to workload management, with the focus shifting to T20Is until the next IPL.

title: 'Things to come': Mahua posts old photo of B'desh arresting ex-poll chief; BJP reacts
content: TMC leader Mahua Moitra sparked controversy by comparing India's election process to Bangladesh's, drawing sharp criticism from the BJP. Meanwhile, Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders voiced concerns over the Election Commission's voter roll revision exercise, alleging it could disenfranchise legitimate voters and calling it a "sinister attempt to destroy Democracy."

title: Cloudflare outage: How AI helped this edtech firm to get back before some big websites
content: A recent Cloudflare outage impacted numerous major websites for nearly six hours. However, Coursera, leveraging AI coding, restored its services much earlier by deploying a clone of basic Cloudflare capabilities. This allowed them to bypass the widespread disruption affecting sites like X, ChatGPT, and Spotify.

title: The house of Lalu: Inside the slow, painful unraveling of Bihar’s most powerful political dynasty
content: Bihar's 2025 election results have triggered a significant crisis within the Rashtriya Janata Dal, leading to a dramatic drop in seats and exposing deep-seated family and organizational rifts.  The fallout includes public declarations of departure and accusations of gatekeeping, casting a shadow over the party's future stability and leadership.

title: Explainer: What to check before buying an air purifier; key features, common myths busted
content: Air quality impacts health, making air purifiers a household necessity. This guide explains how they work, the filters used, and key buying factors like CADR ratings. It debunks common myths and offers maintenance tips. Understanding costs and exploring alternative tech solutions like face masks are also covered. Proper selection and usage ensure cleaner indoor air for everyone.

title: Cambridge picks 'parasocial' as word of the year: What it means
content: Parasocial language has quietly reshaped how today’s youth think, learn, and plan their futures. What began as one-sided admiration has evolved into emotional outsourcing, where influencers and AI systems function as mentors, motivators, and confidants. This shift alters classroom engagement, blurs career expectations, and challenges students to distinguish digital intimacy from genuine connection.

title: Xpeng's Iron robot: Human traits challenge Optimus; why Tesla should worry
content: Chinese EV maker Xpeng is challenging Tesla's Optimus with its humanoid robot, Iron. Emphasizing human-like interaction and comfort, Xpeng aims for Iron to be highly relatable, even huggable.

title: 'Out only in gully cricket': Ashwin on bizarre Ranji dismissal for hitting ball twice
content: A rare 'hit the ball twice' dismissal occurred in the Ranji Trophy, with Manipur's Lamabam Ajay Singh given out for deliberately using his bat to stop the ball from hitting the stumps. This unusual mode of dismissal, governed by MCC Law 34, hasn't been seen in the Ranji Trophy since 2005. R Ashwin reacted sharply to the same on X.

title: How Gen Z in US is reinventing college to survive a volatile job market
content: Gen Z students, facing a tightening job market and rising unemployment among recent graduates, are increasingly turning to double majors as a strategic safeguard. With universities reporting dramatic surges in dual-degree pursuits and research showing significantly reduced income shocks for double majors, students are diversifying skills to stay resilient, adaptable and competitive in an economy shaped by AI and rapid disruption.

title: 'Gogoi can fight polls in Pak': Himanta mocks Cong MP - Assam 2026 battle heats up
content: Political heat rises in Assam ahead of the 2026 assembly polls. Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi criticises the BJP's delimitation and voter revision plans. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said that Gogoi should contest elections in Pakistan after BJP sweeps the 2026 polls. The Election Commission has ordered a special revision of electoral rolls, aiming to identify ineligible voters.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.

title: LiAngelo Ball turns rapper: 'Tweaker' hits platinum, shock crossover
content: LiAngelo Ball, formerly a basketball player, has achieved a major milestone in music. His debut single 'Tweaker' has gone platinum. This success signifies a significant crossover from sports to the entertainment industry. The song became a cultural phenomenon, embraced by sports teams and charting highly. Ball's journey redefines his public identity and highlights his artistic ambition.

title: NBA trade rumor: Rockets eye $118M Mavericks star in blockbuster deal
content: Houston Rockets, surprisingly strong early, are exploring a blockbuster trade for Kyrie Irving to fill the void left by Fred VanVleet's season-ending injury. This move would reunite Irving with Kevin Durant, a partnership that previously generated significant excitement. The proposed deal involves trading VanVleet and Dorian Finney-Smith for Irving, offering Houston a veteran playmaker and elite scorer.

title: Gisele Bündchen says focusing on Tom Brady’s career took personal toll
content: Shannon Sharpe's podcast comments resurfaced, suggesting emotional fulfillment, not wealth, may have driven Gisele Bündchen's divorce from Tom Brady. Sharpe theorized that despite Brady's fortune, unmet needs for time and attention could have eroded their 13-year marriage. This perspective continues to resonate, highlighting that financial security alone cannot sustain relationships under pressure.

title: U-19 World Cup: India to open campaign against USA on January 15; see full schedule
content: India's U-19 cricket team will kick off their 2026 World Cup campaign against the USA on January 15 in Bulawayo. The tournament, co-hosted by Zimbabwe and Namibia, features 16 teams across four groups. India is placed in Group A alongside the USA, Bangladesh, and New Zealand. India and Pakistan are not placed in the same group.

title: Not Sachin, Kohli, or Dravid - Shai Hope becomes 1st batter to achieve this rare feat
content: Shai Hope's brilliant unbeaten 109 in a rain-shortened ODI against New Zealand wasn't enough as the hosts secured a five-wicket victory. Hope's century, his first against New Zealand, saw him equal Brian Lara's 19 ODI hundreds and become the first to score centuries against all Test-playing nations. He also surpassed 6,000 ODI runs.

title: Delhi car blast probe: Al-Falah University ‘raked in’ Rs 415cr from fees; new details emerge
content: Enforcement Directorate arrested Al-Falah group chairman Jawad Siddiqui.  Crores were allegedly siphoned off to family-linked companies.  Contracts for construction and catering were awarded to businesses owned by his wife and children.  The arrest follows a probe into financial irregularities and fraudulent practices.  The agency seized cash and digital devices during searches.

title: Bhopal: Over a dozen masked men vandalize cafe with no intention to loot; probe on
content: Masked assailants stormed a Bhopal café, vandalizing furniture with swords and sticks in a swift, violent attack. CCTV footage of the incident has gone viral. Police are investigating the incident, suspecting personal enmity as the motive behind the unprovoked destruction.

title: PSL in trouble! Team owner who tore up notice, now threatens legal action on league
content: Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen publicly claims the franchise is being excluded from the PSL's valuation and renewal process, citing a lack of response from league management. Tareen stated that despite multiple attempts through formal and legal channels, the team has received no communication, prompting a warning of potential legal action if the impasse continues.

title: ‘Subject close to heart’: PM Modi hails farming sector reforms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi envisioned India as a global natural farming hub, highlighting a significant transformation in the agriculture sector over the past decade. He noted agricultural exports have nearly doubled, with youth increasingly embracing farming as a modern career.  The PM lauded Tamil Nadu farmers for their courage and innovation at a recent summit.

title: Jaishankar opens two new consulates in Russia; hails Delhi-Moscow ties
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Wednesday inaugurated two new Consulates General in Russia, Yekaterinburg and Kazan. This move marks a significant step in deepening India and Russia bilateral ties. The new missions will foster economic, technological, and scientific cooperation. They will also support the large Indian community residing in Russia.

title: Kolkata: Woman receives bullet injury in Howrah housing complex; husband detained
content: A woman was injured by a bullet grazed her neck inside a residential complex in Howrah's Shibpur area. Her husband claims the incident was accidental while cleaning his licensed firearm. Police are investigating the husband's statement and the circumstances of the firing.

title: Verdict in absentia, empathy in short supply: Reading B'desh through its Hasina coverage
content: Bangladeshi media largely avoids sharp criticism following Sheikh Hasina's death sentence, instead adopting a matter-of-fact tone. Coverage reveals little empathy for Hasina, with minimal interrogation of her claims of a rigged tribunal. The nation's newspapers are discussing her downfall as a settled matter, shifting focus to the political vacuum she leaves behind.

title: ED attaches 9 luxury Dubai properties worth Rs 51.7 cr; linked to bank fraud
content: The Enforcement Directorate has seized nine luxury properties in Dubai valued at over Rs 51 crore. These assets are linked to a massive Rs 1,266 crore fraud against the State Bank of India. The fraud allegedly involves Advantage Overseas Private Limited and its owner Shrikant Bhasi. Funds were siphoned off through shell companies and used to acquire these foreign assets.

title: 28 people died since SIR began: Mamata; Bengal CM claims 'inhuman' pressure on workers
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed deep concern over the death of a Booth Level Officer in Jalpaiguri, attributing it to "unbearable pressure" from the ongoing Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls.

title: 'Venomous rhetoric': Citizens pen letter against Rahul; accuse Cong of making unsubstantiated claims
content: A group of 272 eminent citizens, including retired judges, bureaucrats, and military officers, have penned an open letter criticizing Rahul Gandhi and the Congress for allegedly undermining constitutional bodies, particularly the Election Commission. The letter accuses the opposition of baseless rhetoric and "systematic and conspiratorial attacks" against the ECI, urging civil society to support the institution.

title: IIT Bombay vs IIT Madras: Which institute is home to higher number of female students?
content: India’s IITs have long struggled with low female enrolment, prompting the introduction of supernumerary seats from 2018 to address the widening gender gap. As gender diversity becomes a key priority, fresh data reveals that IIT Bombay hosts 1,677 women compared to IIT Madras’s 1,587. The comparison underscores both progress and the persistent structural barriers limiting girls’ entry into engineering.

title: ICC rankings: Rohit Sharma's reign ends! NZ star becomes World No1 ODI batter
content: Daryl Mitchell has dethroned Rohit Sharma to become the world's top ODI batsman, a historic feat for New Zealand.  This shift highlights significant movements across all formats, with Pakistan's players climbing ODI rankings and India's Jasprit Bumrah maintaining his Test bowling supremacy.  South Africa's Temba Bavuma also entered the top five Test batters.

title: Happy International Men's Day: 75+ messages, wishes, greetings and quotes
content: International Men's Day 2025 is being celebrated to recognize men's diverse strengths, contributions, and values in families, communities, and society. The occasion emphasizes encouraging positive role models, promoting gender equality, and supporting men's mental well-being. Heartfelt messages, wishes, and quotes are shared to express gratitude, encouragement, and recognition for men's invaluable presence and impact.

title: Aishwarya Rai shares stage with PM Modi, Sachin at Sai centenary; speech praised - video
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan joined Prime Minister Narendra Modi and other dignitaries at Sri Sathya Sai Baba's birth centenary celebrations in Puttaparthi.  She delivered a powerful address emphasizing humanity, love, and unity, stating there is only one caste: humanity. Her message resonated with the crowd, highlighting Sai Baba's enduring legacy of compassion and service.

title: India vs China: Who sends more engineering students to the US?
content: India has surged past China in sending engineering students to the US, a significant shift reshaping America's STEM landscape. With nearly twice as many Indian engineering students as Chinese, India now dominates this critical field, influencing the future technical workforce. This trend highlights India's focused technical mobility versus China's diversified academic outflow.

title: Trump sanctions a 'crude' shock! Russia oil to India drops by 66%
content: US sanctions on Russian oil giants Rosneft and Lukoil have significantly impacted India's crude imports, with shipments plummeting by 66% in November. Refineries are now wary of US penalties, leading to reduced new orders and expedited existing ones. This shift forces Russian exporters to adopt more opaque shipping methods to navigate sanctions.

title: Haryana horror: Dancer slapped, dragged and hit with stick at wedding - act caught on cam
content: A dancer was assaulted at a pre-wedding event in Nuh, Haryana, after objecting to inappropriate behavior from a groom's relative. The performer, Payal Choudhary, was attacked on stage when she pushed away a man's hand holding currency notes. The assault escalated, with multiple individuals joining in, and other dancers and an intervener were also beaten.

title: Ind vs SA: Gautam Gambhir to be removed as head coach? Sourav Ganguly drops blunt verdict
content: Sourav Ganguly clarified Eden Gardens' pitch preparation, stating BCCI curators took charge four days prior to the India-South Africa Test. He admitted the surface wasn't ideal for the Indian batting lineup. Curator Sujan Mukherjee confirmed he prepared the wicket as per team management's request, with Gautam Gambhir reportedly wanting such a pitch.

title: Watch: Rohini Acharya slams journalist for saying 'married daughters' remark; video viral
content: Rohini Acharya, daughter of Lalu Prasad, strongly criticized a journalist's remark that married daughters shouldn't spend much time at their parents' home. She also condemned accusations of profiting from her kidney donation to her father, urging critics to donate themselves instead.

title: IND vs SA: 'Leave your ego in the dressing room'- Gavaskar tears into India’s approach
content: Following India's Test defeat to South Africa, Sunil Gavaskar urged management and selectors to prioritize proven domestic performers over limited-overs all-rounders. He stressed Test cricket demands specialists, patience, and discipline, not players selected on ego or short-term form. Gavaskar highlighted the need for batters accustomed to home conditions and warned against conflating limited-overs needs with Test expectations.

title: 'Oh, we’re making a lot of progress, huh?’: Trump’s exchange with Palestinian journalist — watch
content: US President Donald Trump claimed Palestinians “liked” him and were “doing well” while speaking alongside Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman at the White House. He also said Gaza was now “much safer.” His remarks came as Hamas rejected a UN-backed US resolution based on Trump’s 20-point Gaza peace plan.

title: Tesla's First India Centre To Open In Gurugram This Month
content: Electric car-maker Tesla is set to bolster its India presence with the opening of its first full-fledged centre in Gurugram this month, marking a key milestone in its bid to expand volumes and retail visibility.

title: Newborn Dies After Delivery In Karnataka Hospital Corridor
content: In a tragic incident, a newborn died at the state-run Haveri Women and Children's hospital in Karnataka, allegedly due to the negligence of hospital staff, police said on Wednesday.

title: "Absolutely Not A Setback": PMK President Anbumani Ramadoss On Internal Rift
content: PMK President Anbumani Ramadoss has dismissed concerns that the party's internal conflict will weaken its chances in the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly election.

title: Robbers In Bengaluru Pose As Tax Officers, Loot Crores From Cash Van
content: In a major daylight robbery in Bengaluru, a group of armed men posing as Central Tax officers interepreted an ATM cash-loading vehicle near the Ashoka Pillar and looted worth crores of rupees.

title: 'Contribution Of Immigrants Phenomenal': Sundar Pichai On H-1B Visa Crackdown
content: Sundar Pichai has praised the role of immigrants in shaping the US' technology landscape, calling their contributions "phenomenal". He said that the government "understands it" and that there are still avenues to bring "talented individuals".

title: Supreme Court Strikes Down Key Provisions Of Tribunal Reforms Law
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday directed the Centre to constitute a national tribunals commission within four months as it struck down key provisions of the 2021 Tribunals Reforms law related to appointment, tenure and service conditions of tribunal m

title: PM Inaugurates Tamil Nadu Farmers Summit, Holds Roadshow Months Ahead Of Polls
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today inaugurated the Natural Farmers Summit in Coimbatore, a mega gathering that would bring together nearly 50,000 farmers from across South India to promote natural and indigenous farming practices.

title: Nitish Cabinet Formation: 5 Key Factors That Will Shape The New Team
content: With the NDA's resounding victory in Bihar, all eyes are now on Nitish Kumar's new cabinet. The veteran leader will take oath as Chief Minister for the tenth time on 20th November, and the state can have up to 36 ministers besides the Chief Minister.

title: Video: Volcano Erupts In Indonesia, Spews Ash 13km Into Sky
content: A volcano on Indonesia's main island of Java erupted on Wednesday, throwing ash and gas kilometres into the sky and forcing officials to raise the alert status to its highest level.

title: Rajasthan Official Dies Of Heart Attack, Family Claims SIR Workload To Blame
content: A Booth Level Officer (BLO) engaged in Special Intensive Revision (SIR) work died of a heart attack in Rajasthan's Sawai Madhopur district on Wednesday morning, minutes after receiving a phone call from the tehsildar, his family members alleged.

title: Pay Cut Warning Sent To Dead Teachers Over Attendance In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a bizarre episode that could put even a horror-comedy script to shame, the Education Department in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa has managed a rare administrative feat sending e-attendance notices to three teachers who died months.

title: All About Anmol Bishnoi, Accused In Baba Siddique, Sidhu Moosewala Murders
content: Delivering a major blow to organised crime, the National Investigation Agency arrested gangster Anmol Bishnoi on Wednesday after he was deported by the United States.

title: Extinct In Gujarat Since 1989, Tiger Makes A Comeback
content: More than three decades after tigers went extinct in Gujarat, a wandering big cat has made Ratanmahal Wildlife Sanctuary its new home, raising hopes for the revival of the striped animal in the state, known as the last abode of Asiatic lions.

title: Bengal Poll Officer Allegedly Dies By Suicide; Work Pressure, Says Family
content: Tension spread in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri district after the body of a woman booth level officer (BLO) was found in the courtyard of her house in a suspected case of death by suicide.

title: Former US Treasury Secretary Larry Summers Quits OpenAI Over Epstein Mails
content: Former U.S. Treasury Secretary Larry Summers is resigning from OpenAI's board of directors, the ChatGPT maker and his office said Wednesday.

title: Adani Group Wins Lenders' Approval For Jaiprakash Associate Takeover
content: Adani Group has won majority lenders' vote for take over of debt-laden Jaiprakash Associates as its Rs 14,535-crore acquisition proposal included a higher upfront payment than rival bidders, sources said.

title: On Camera, Masked Men With Sticks, Swords Barge Into Bhopal Cafe
content: A group of masked men armed with swords, rods and sticks stormed a cafe in Bhopal today in a swift two-minute attack that was captured on CCTV.

title: VVPATs Not Mandatory For Local Body Polls In Maharashtra, High Court Told
content: The Maharashtra State Election Commission on Wednesday told the Bombay High Court that the use of VVPAT machines was not mandatory for local body polls, and it was also not technically feasible.

title: Trump Reunites With Elon Musk At White House, Internet Says "Bros Are Back"
content: Billionaire Elon Musk was back in the White House on Tuesday night, joining US President Donald Trump for a state dinner honouring Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman.

title: Paris Auction Of World's 1st Calculator Developed By Blaise Pascal Suspended
content: Christie's said Wednesday it was suspending the Paris auction of one of just a handful of examples of the world's first calculating machine, developed by French mathematician and inventor Blaise Pascal in 1642.

content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. content: Partha, senior assistant editor (markets) at The Times of India, Mumbai, covers the financial markets, mainly the stock market, mutual funds, banking and insurance sectors. He is a sports enthusiast. His hobby is philately. title: Anthony Yarde hoping third time's a charm in David Benavidez world title showdown
content: Anthony Yarde was stopped by artur Beterbiev and Sergey Kovalev in 2023 and 2019 respectively . the 34-year-old says he will be better in his third attempt at winning a world light heavyweight title on sunday . he was stopped in eight rounds for three versions of the world title, after lasting 11 rounds .

title: Best stories, wildest celebrations from amazing round of qualifiers
content: the November international break delivered more than its fair share of thrills and spills as more national teams secured their place at the 2026 finals . the break produced a plethora of qualifying drama as tiny nations reached the finals for the first time, last-minute goals decided matches and a handful of major names tumbled by the wayside .

title: Free agent pickups: Believe in Brissett to replace your injured QB?
content: the 11th Sunday of the NFL season began with the final international game of the season, as the Miami Dolphins topped the Washington Commanders in Madrid, Spain . much happened in between, including the Buffalo Bills QB Josh Allen accounting for six touchdowns, the Arizona Cardinals quarterback Jacoby Brissett breaking the NFL record with 47 completed passes . we await further clarity on which quarterbacks will be available for Week 12 .

title: Let's talk about North Texas -- why the Mean Green is the bet to make in December
content: north Texas is sitting -115 both ways to make or miss the playoff . the committee is reacting to resumes, but not quality wins . UNT has one loss, a 63-36 defensive collapse to south Florida .

title: What we're hearing on the WNBA's CBA negotiations
content: the WNBA and WNBPA agreed on a 30-day extension of the current CBA . it remains unclear what the players think of this proposal and whether it moves the needle ahead of the new Nov. 30 deadline . the union did not respond to requests for comment Tuesday night .

title: Panthers, Rangers reveal Winter Classic jerseys
content: the 17th NHL Winter Classic is scheduled for Jan. 2 at LoanDepot Park . it's the southernmost outdoor game ever played in the NHL . the Panthers' winter Classic jersey references the team's original "leaping panther" logo .

title: What we learned from Duke's win over Kansas at Champions Classic
content: the 15th edition of Champions Classic ended with wins for the Kentucky Wildcats and Duke Blue Devils . the Spartans ran away with a 17-point victory, and the no. 5 blue Devils sealed the 12-point win . ESPN's college basketball reporter Myron Medcalf and NBA draft analyst Jeremy Woo break down what they're taking away from a star-studded night in new york .

title: NHL Bubble Watch: Projecting playoff hopes for all 32 teams
content: no team in the east was more than four points out of the wild-card spot . in the west, all but three teams were within three points of a playoff spot. this month, we're also looking at points of concern early this season for teams inside and outside the bubble.

title: Updated Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus who's under the most pressure for each team
content: we restacked the NFL heading into week 12 . we asked our NFL Nation reporters to pick one player, coach or executive who is under the most pressure for each team . how many picks are the same from when we asked the same question .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5’s flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: O's acquire Ward from Angels for RHP Rodriguez
content: the Baltimore Orioles acquired outfielder Taylor Ward from the Los Angeles Angels in exchange for right-hander Grayson Rodriguez . the pair went into the offseason seeking a top-of-the-rotation starter and hope to get one in Ward . Rodriguez was drafted no. 11 overall out of high school in 2018 and showed promise in his first two big league seasons .

title: 🎉 Bottom 10: Even in defeat, we have a blast
content: 'Cause there's a spark in you You just gotta ignite the light And let it shine Just own the night Like the Fourth of July 'Caty Perry Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . we believe that it is important to celebrate all life's victories, whether those triumphs be large or be they small .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, whether the Big Ten likes it or not . the winner of a week 13 showdown between USC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .
